comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110930134708

Steps to reproduce:

In Fedora 16, x86_64, I opened http://streaming01.sr-online.de/sr2_2.m3u for playing a mp3 radio stream.

Installed: firefox-7.0.1-3.fc16.x86_64
vlc-plugin-jack-1.1.12-1.fc16.x86_64
vlc-1.1.12-1.fc16.x86_64
vlc-core-1.1.12-1.fc16.x86_64



Actual results:

Only a black popup window appears. No sound!

Error console:

Error: gBrowser.addProgressListener was called with a second argument,
which is not supported. See bug 608628.
Source File: chrome://browser/content/tabbrowser.xml
Line: 1862

This happens even if all FF extension are deactivated.


Expected results:

The radio stream plays.

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110930134708

Steps to reproduce:

In Fedora 16, x86_64, I opened http://streaming01.sr-online.de/sr2_2.m3u for playing a mp3 radio stream.

Installed: firefox-7.0.1-3.fc16.x86_64
vlc-plugin-jack-1.1.12-1.fc16.x86_64
vlc-1.1.12-1.fc16.x86_64
vlc-core-1.1.12-1.fc16.x86_64



Actual results:

Only a black popup window appears. No sound!

Error console:

Error: gBrowser.addProgressListener was called with a second argument,
which is not supported. See bug 608628.
Source File: chrome://browser/content/tabbrowser.xml
Line: 1862

This happens even if all FF extension are deactivated.


Expected results:

The radio stream plays.
